thread.title: Apple stock steady prior to big products launch
thread.title_full: Apple stock steady prior to big products launch - CNET

author: Terry Collins
title: Apple stock steady prior to big products launch
text:
Apple
Apple shares traded little changed Wednesday morning as investors appeared to take a wait-and-see attitude ahead of a San Francisco event at which CEO Tim Cook is expected to take the wraps off the company's latest gadgets.
Shares of the consumer electronics giant rose 0.5% to $112.96 ahead of the event, during which new versions of its popular iPhone and iPad will likely be announced. A new version of its Apple TV streaming media device is also expected.
Investors are anxious to see if the new products are exciting enough to fuel the next leg of the tech giant's growth. The Cupertino, California-based company's product launches are closely watched events, particularly when new iPhones are rolled out.
Apple is dependent on iPhone sales, which now account for roughly two thirds of its annual revenue. Last year, Apple generated a record $182.8 billion in sales with $38.5 billion in net income.
The smartphones expected at the event will likely include updates of Apple's iPhone 6, which features a 4.7-inch screen, and the even-larger iPhone 6 Plus, which sports a 5.5-inch screen. Both phones were introduced a year ago.
Related Links Apple's September 9 iPhone -- and more -- launch Live Apple's iPhone 6S: The peak of smartphone boredom? Inside Scoop: Apple iPhone 6S event to focus on hardware Apple stock is up 1.75 percent since the start of the year, but its shares have fallen roughly 17 percent since mid-July as anticipation of a new iPhone mounted. The company has a market capitalization of $642 billion. Search engine giant Google is the next most valuable company at $425 billion.
This is a developing story. Follow: CNET's Apple live blog and see all of today's Apple news
